content: nothing makes reading more fun than having a cute bookmark to mark your page learn to crochet this beginner friendly lacy bookmark inspired by jane austen s pride and prejudice novel this bookmark uses approximately 30 yards of cotton yarn dk or worsted and takes under 30 minutes to make it uses the spider stitch which is a combination of single_crochet and chain spaces this is the perfect project for beginners book lovers or crocheters looking for ways to use up their scrap yarn there are step-by-step pictures for crocheting the bookmark adding a tassel and blocking it as well as a complete video tutorial for extra support > the free pattern for the elizabeth bennet bookmark can be found here 1 > the complete video tutorial for the elizabeth bennet bookmark can be found here 2 skill level easy / advanced beginner language english crochet terminology us terms crochet stitch single_crochet chain stitch two sizes 1 dk weight 1 5 wide x 6 long 2 worsted / aran weight 1 75 wide x 7 5 long other details * 4 0mm crochet hook needed * 30 yards of any medium 4 worsted or dk 3 weight yarn can be used preferably cotton * a tassel can be added to the end of the bookmark but this is optional i hope you enjoy making your bookmarks 1 https //thispixiecreates com/how-to-crochet-the-elizabeth-bennet-bookmark/ 2 https //youtu be/azmmsulzlqq
